doc.field: Letter to Chloe Unity Blair, fragment, n.d. [a machine-readable transcription]
Letter to Chloe Unity Blair, fragment, n.d. [a machine-readable transcription]
James and John Booker tend to use commas instead of periods to end a sentence. In the modernized version of this letter, we have regularized punctuation in unambiguous cases.
James and John Booker tend to use commas instead of periods to end a sentence. In the modernized version of this letter, we have regularized punctuation in unambiguous cases.

James Reynolds sends his best respects to you, I was verry sorry to hear that my sweetheart was about to leave me, to hunt for another one in such a time as this, tho if she sees eny body that she likes better than she does me she can have my concent to take him, and I will go another way,
Nothing more but remain your frend and cousin until death James Booker
Letter to Chloe Unity Blair, fragment
